column4: could someone pleeeeezzzz help me with setting me up my svideo on my geforce 6600
I think there is a guide on the wiki, have you seen it?
no i havn't. what is the www?
I don't know, do a search at help.ubuntu.com
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/NvidiaTVOut?highlight=%28nvidia%29%7C%28s-video%29
also https://help.ubuntu.com/community/NvidiaTVOutNewbieEdition?highlight=%28nvidia%29%7C%28out%29%7C%28tv%29
thnx
i tried both the wiki's (for tv out nvidia) you sent me to both didn't work. any advise
no sorry, I've never set that up.  Maybe you can search the forums too
gksudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf
the plugin or content?
the content
use wget
How do I do that
wget http://www.somewhere.com/path/to/flash.swf
tools > page info   might work too
the media tab should list flash stuff and the you can "save as"
is there another way because my wget doesn't want to start. it just says starting the quits
did you see the second thing I said about  Tools > Page Info  in firefox?
yes I did.but wget is giving me errors when I try to start it.it doesn't even open
but the second way doesn't require wget
sorry I ditn't read. thanx
it doesn't save. any other ideas
what page?
http://www.ilogic.co.za/taxi-wars.html, thanx man
wget http://www.ilogic.co.za/taxiwars.swf    is working fine
MY wget itn't working. it starts opening and then it just dies.
try curl
do you use a proxy or something?
I don't use a proxy. I can't find curl
sudo apt-get install curl
and can you pastebin the output from wget?
I found curl. wget doesn't give me any output
how are you running it?
I click on the gwet icon it says "starting" and then dies
no, wget is a command you put in the terminal: wget http://www.ilogic.co.za/taxiwars.swf
I was running Gwget. thanx
where does it save to
current directory
Thanx a stack man
do you receive any errors?
no nothing
how are you trying to copy?
right click copy, then right click past
try in a terminal
how do I copy from the drive to a windows network drive
is the windows network drive mounted somewhere?  you can just do 'cp from_location to_location'
well I just clicked on places and network servers and took it from there. how do I do that in terminal
I don't think those get mounted anywhere (or I don't know where).  This is using samba right?
yes
yes it is using smb
instead of mounting it with the gui, use the mount command to mount in a directory somewhere and then try copying in a terminal
thanx a stack
1 last question. what command do I use to copy multiple directories
cp -a dir1 dir2 ... dir_to_copy_to
thanx
I tried to mount the windows drive but it keeps telling me that there is no such file or directory, even though I can open it with the GUI
did you create the mount point first?
do you mean: mkdir /usbwindows ?
yeah
yes
it cant find the windows mount point. but i see it in the gui
hmm, maybe unmount it from the gui first (I don't use samba but I assume that is possible somehow)
thanx
sorry how do i copy multiple directries again
cp -a dir1 dir2 ... dir_to_copy_to
thanx
what is the -a for
cp won't copy directories by default
i c
how do I type into the terminal of the directory name is: J Download - Other (with the spaces) I want to copy from it

well you can either let the shell worry about it and use tab completion, or escape the spaces yourself like this:  directory\ with\ spaces   or you can just surround it in quotation marks:  'directory with spaces'
is there a way that I can temp. disable the auto mount for usb devices
system > preferences > removable drives and media
thanx
Sorry to bother again. copying over the network is just taking too long. I have put the drive in my machine. it is a IDE drive (the 3rd) how do I know what to mount it as (hda, hdc etc)
sudo fdisk -l     should list them all, and 'mount' should tell you which ones are already mounted so you can narrow it down that way
when I run this command I get this output (i already have a ntfs drive mounted this way) sudo ntfs-3g /dev/hdc1 /media/Jacques
sorry
do you want me to past it into pastbin for you
I haven't seen that before, but just read over the options and choose the one that is easiest for you
it gives me this on the linux machine. this is what is weire
how do I unmount
umount /dev/foobar
thanx
sorry, how do i check if hda, hdb etc. my window closed and i lost the command
sudo fdisk -l     should list them all, and 'mount' should tell you which ones are already mounted so you can narrow it down that way
thanx
